ingredients: -Japanese Red Camellia Oil: One of the most rapidly absorbed oils, rich in antioxidants, essential lipids, and vitamins A, C, and E to nourish, hydrate, and enhance shine...Aqua / Water / Eau, Glycerin, Cetearyl Alcohol, Cocos Nucifera Oil / Coconut Oil, Cetyl Esters, Cetyl Alcohol, Amodimethicone, Behentrimonium Methosulfate, Phenoxyethanol, Camellia Japonica Seed Oil, Trideceth-6, Dilauryl Thiodipropionate, Chlorhexidine Digluconate, Hexyl Cinnamal, Hydroxycitronellal, Cetrimonium Chloride, Lactic Acid, Isoeugenol, Parfum / Fragrance.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.For hair.-Apply one to two pumps into palm, depending on hair thickness and length..-Work product into the palms of hands and distribute throughout damp hair..-For hair hydration, apply on damp or dry hair and work through lengths and ends..-To define shape, apply on damp or dry hair and use fingertips to define and style...For skin:.-For eyebrows, smooth over skin and eyebrows for moisture and shape control..-For facial hair, gently smooth over beard or mustache to soften..-For hands, nails, and cuticles, apply on dry area to moisturize and protect against future dryness..-Follow with the full Essence Absolue range (sold separately) for the ultimate professional care..-Can be applied to dry hair lengths and ends as well as on eyebrows, elbows, facial hair, hands, nails, and cuticles, whenever a hydration refresh is needed...Pro tips:.-Mix with the Essence Absolue Nourishing Protective Hair Oil (sold separately) for increased moisture, hydration, and shine on hair..-Keep your Essence Absolue Nourishing Universal Balm in your bag to ensure you always have hydrated hair and skin on the go.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I was sent this product for free in exchange for an honest review and couldn't wait to try it out. The first thing I noticed was that the scent is exactly that of a cherry Jolly Rancher. Not what I expected from a luxury product...but I don't exactly hate it! I am giving this product a mixed review because that's what I found it to be. A product with mixed objectives, trying to do too much and not able to achieve all of its promises. The bad: it didn't get there for me as a moisturizing hair balm. I have thick hair with some wave and didn't notice any additive moisture after use. There was also very minimal instruction of how much to use. A pea size? A quarter? More? I was mindful that I didn't want it to feel greasy either so maybe I didn't use enough and will continue to be hopeful and play with the range, but I just wasn't impressed. I typically use an olive oil based conditioner and see better results from that. The good news: As a skin balm, this is great! I used this on rougher areas like elbows and feet and it has kept them very smooth.

reviews.review_title: A Luxurious Must-Have for Hair: Shu Uemura Essence
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I recently had the pleasure of trying out the Shu Uemura Essence Absolue Nourishing Universal Balm, and I must say, it has quickly become an essential part of my haircare routine. This product is nothing short of a game-changer.  First and foremost, the packaging is both sleek and convenient. The small jar is easy to store and take on the go, making it perfect for travel. But the real magic lies inside the jar.  The balm itself is a silky, lightweight texture that instantly melts into my hair without leaving any greasy residue. I have fine, straight hair, and I was initially worried that this balm might be too heavy, but I was pleasantly surprised. It's incredibly nourishing without weighing my hair down.  The scent is heavenly u2013 a delicate floral aroma that lingers throughout the day, leaving my hair smelling fresh and luxurious.  The true beauty of this product lies in its versatility. I use it as a pre-shampoo treatment to deeply nourish my hair, as a leave-in conditioner to tame frizz and add shine, and even as a styling aid to smooth flyaways. It works wonders in all these roles, and a little goes a long way.  After just a few weeks of incorporating Shu Uemura's Essence Absolue Nourishing Universal Balm into my haircare routine, I've noticed a remarkable improvement in the overall health and appearance of my hair. It looks and feels softer, shinier, and healthier than ever before.  While this product may come with a higher price tag, it's undoubtedly worth every penny. If you're looking for a versatile, high-quality hair treatment that delivers on its promises, I highly recommend giving Shu Uemura's Essence Absolue Nourishing Universal Balm a try. It's now a staple in my haircare collection, and I can't imagine going without it.
